skill.name: pytdc
skill.description: Therapeutics Data Commons. AI-ready drug discovery datasets (ADME, toxicity, DTI), benchmarks, scaffold splits, molecular oracles, for therapeutic ML and pharmacological prediction.
skill.summary: Therapeutics Data Commons. AI-ready drug discovery datasets (ADME, toxicity, DTI), benchmarks, scaff...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: This is PyTDC (Therapeutics Data Commons), a legitimate open-source scientific library for drug discovery ML. All 401 static findings are false positives: markdown backticks flagged as shell commands, protein target names (GSK3B, DRD2) flagged as C2 keywords, ML random seeds flagged as weak crypto, and dictionary keys flagged as certificate files. The skill accesses curated pharmaceutical datasets and provides benchmarks - no malicious behavior present.

content.user_title: Access drug discovery datasets for ML
content.value_statement: Access AI-ready drug discovery datasets for therapeutic ML including ADME properties, toxicity predictions, and drug-target interactions. Get standardized benchmarks and evaluation metrics for pharmaceutical machine learning research.
actual_capabilities: Access 50+ curated drug discovery datasets across ADME, toxicity, and DTI categories
Apply standardized train/test splits including scaffold splits and cold splits
Evaluate models with built-in metrics (ROC-AUC, RMSE, MAE, F1, and more)
Use molecular oracles for property optimization in generation tasks
Run benchmark group evaluations with multi-seed protocols
limitations: Dataset downloads require internet access to remote repositories
Specialized molecular features require additional package installations
Some datasets have usage restrictions - check individual dataset licenses

use_cases.title: Train ADME prediction models
use_cases.description: Load curated absorption, metabolism, and toxicity datasets to train ML models for pharmaceutical property prediction.

use_cases.target_user: ML Engineers Building Life Science Applications
use_cases.title: Benchmark drug-target interactions
use_cases.description: Evaluate binding affinity predictions using standardized DTI datasets and proper cold-split evaluation protocols.

use_cases.title: Reproduce therapeutic ML research
use_cases.description: Access benchmark groups with proper 5-seed evaluation to reproduce and compare model performance across ADMET tasks.

prompt_templates.title: Load ADME dataset
prompt_templates.prompt: Load the Caco2_Wang ADME dataset from PyTDC and show me the train/validation/test split using scaffold method

prompt_templates.title: Train toxicity model
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a hERG toxicity prediction workflow using PyTDC with scaffold split and evaluate using ROC-AUC

prompt_templates.title: Run benchmark evaluation
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a full ADMET benchmark group evaluation on my model using the standard 5-seed protocol and report mean and standard deviation

prompt_templates.title: Generate molecules
prompt_templates.prompt: Use PyTDC oracles to optimize generated molecules for GSK3B binding affinity and drug-likeness (QED score)

output_examples.input: Load the Caco2_Wang dataset and create scaffold splits

best_practices: Always use scaffold splits for molecular property prediction to ensure test molecules have unseen chemical scaffolds
Run evaluations with 5 different seeds and report mean Â± std for reproducible benchmark comparisons
Check dataset-specific requirements before use - some datasets require additional dependencies or have citation requirements
anti_patterns: Using random splits for molecular data - this leads to data leakage from similar molecules in train and test sets
Reporting single-seed results - always use multiple seeds to account for variability in ML model training
Ignoring dataset licenses - some TDC datasets have specific academic or commercial use restrictions

faq.question: What datasets are available in PyTDC?
faq.answer: PyTDC includes 50+ datasets covering ADME properties, toxicity, drug-target interactions, drug-drug interactions, quantum mechanics, and molecule generation.

faq.question: How do I choose the right split method?
faq.answer: Use scaffold split for molecular property prediction. Use cold_drug or cold_target for drug-target interaction tasks to test generalization to unseen entities.

faq.question: What evaluation metrics are supported?
faq.answer: PyTDC supports ROC-AUC, PR-AUC, F1, Accuracy for classification and RMSE, MAE, R2, Pearson, Spearman for regression tasks.

faq.question: Do I need to install additional packages?
faq.answer: Core dependencies install automatically. Specialized features like certain oracles or molecular representations may require additional packages.

faq.question: How do I cite PyTDC in my research?
faq.answer: Reference the NeurIPS 2021 paper 'Therapeutics Data Commons' when using TDC datasets in academic publications.

faq.question: Can I use PyTDC for commercial applications?
faq.answer: Check individual dataset licenses. The TDC library is MIT licensed, but underlying datasets may have different usage terms.
